meta.name: Evaluate AI workflows using Google Sheets, Gemini, Claude, GPT, and Perplexity

parameters.content:
Evaluation Trigger

Data Table or Google Sheets -> Expand in the future?

checkIfEvaluating

Flow branch -> Like if
Workflow either goes evaluation route or normal

set outputs

Put the results from the run into Google Sheets or Data Table

set metrics

Evaluates how your run performed. May use a Model

Uses - AI


Correctness: Whether the answer's meaning is consistent with a supplied reference answer. Uses a scale of 1 to 5, with 5 being the best.

Helpfulness: Whether the response answers the given query. Uses a scale of 1 to 5, with 5 being the best.

String Similarity: How close the answer is to the reference answer, measured character-by-character (edit distance). Returns a score between 0 and 1.

Categorization: Whether the answer is an exact match with the reference answer. Returns 1 when matching and 0 otherwise.

Tools Used: Whether the execution used tools or not. Returns a score between 0 and 1.

## Example 1 Categorization


Categorization: Whether the answer is an exact match with the reference answer. Returns 1 when matching and 0 otherwise.


World Series Winners - No results 2024 and 2025

## Example 2 Tools Used


Tools Used: Whether the execution used tools or not. Returns a score between 0 and 1.

World Series Winners - Use Perplexity to get new results

parameters.expectedAnswer: ={{ $('When fetching a dataset row3').item.json['Expected clean data'] }}

parameters.content:
## Example 3 String Similarity


String Similarity: How close the answer is to the reference answer, measured character-by-character (edit distance). Returns a score between 0 and 1.


Data Cleaning Validation

## Example 5 Correctness

Data Table + non AI Agent Node

Correctness: Whether the answer's meaning is consistent with a supplied reference answer. Uses a scale of 1 to 5, with 5 being the best.


Option 2: Summary Accuracy Testing

Set Node with long articles/documents
AI Agent generates summaries
Set Node with reference summaries
Eval Node scores if AI summary captures the same core meaning

## Example 4 Helpfulness


Helpfulness: Whether the response answers the given query. Uses a scale of 1 to 5, with 5 being the best.

Option 1: Product Description Rewriting

Manual Trigger with original product descriptions
AI Agent rewrites them to be more compelling/concise
Set Node with ideal rewritten versions
Eval Node checks if meaning/key details are preserved (1-5 scale)

## Evaluations in Action

This is a blank demo of a workflow where someone wants to use an information extractor. We grab a test dataset and look at using evaluations to improve the prompt

## Setup steps
This template/tutorial goes through 6 different examples of utilizing evaluations in n8n that you can copy and paste into your workflows.

If you want to learn even more about how each evaluation works, there is a detailed YouTube video embedded in the template


## How it works
1. Evaluations start with fetching a test dataset in data tables or google sheets
2. We then pass this into our AI Node which can be an agent, llm chain, information extractor or more
3. After our AI nodes we have a check if evaluating node which splits our data. When testing with evaluations we branch the data north
4. Once in the Evaluations branch we set the outputs to the original data table or sheets and then look at the desired metrics we want to test
5. More evaluation data is present in the evaluations tab. The started plan only allows 1 evaluation workflow per account


## Quick Notes

Thank you for downloading our free n8n Evaluations template. If you enjoyed the template + tutorial please subscribe to the YouTube channel. We are uploading weekly content on AI/n8n

### Connect With Us
Check out the links down below. If you need help with this template, want 1:1 coaching, or have a n8n project you want to build, reach out at ryannolandata@gmail.com

1. Free Skool AI/n8n Group: https://www.skool.com/data-and-ai
2. LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ryan-p-nolan/
3. Twitter/X:https://x.com/RyanMattDS
4. Website: https://ryanandmattdatascience.com/

parameters.text: =Who won the world series for: {{ $json.year }} Only output the team name. If you do not know write: Undetermined

=Who won the world series for: {{ $json.year }} Only output the team name. If you do not know write: Undetermined.

Before writing Undetermined use the perplexity tool as it has up to date information

=Standardize this address to proper US postal format with correct capitalization, spacing, and punctuation. Return only the cleaned address:


Address to clean: {{$json.messydata}}

=Rewrite this product description to be more compelling and customer-focused while keeping it concise. 

Requirements:
- Preserve ALL key specifications and features
- Make it more engaging and benefit-driven
- Keep the same essential information
- Aim for 2-3 sentences maximum
- Use active, persuasive language

Original description:
